chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant John G. Beles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).
  • Incest with Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.06(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
--------------------------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No contact with L.A.B. dob 05/30/2009, without approval of victim's mother and probation agent. No unsupervised contact with minors.
--------------------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  
--------------------------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
--------------------------------------------
Register as a sex offender and comply with SORP conditions and expectations of program.
--------------------------------------------

Pay DA service fees in the amount of $560.00.0
Pay Sheriff's fees in the amount of $160.00.
--------------------------------------------

records.addlTxt: IT IS ORDERED that the time for filing a notice of appeal is extended to September 26, 2019. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.82(2)(a).
Motion to Extend 8 26 19

Post-Conviction Motion before the Honorable Kristine Drettwan on August 6, 2019
Court Reporter Linda Matoska
Original Order to Produce filed with Court.
Denying Motion

1:58 pm Defendant John G. Beles in court, in custody with attorney Catherine Malchow.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:58 pm  Matter is on for defendant's motion to modify sentence based on a new factor.
1:59 pm  State is in compliance with victims' rights.
1:59 pm  Burden of proof is on the defense to show by clear, convincing and satisfactory evidence that there is new evidence that was not considered at trial.
2 pm  Attorney Malchow supplements the relevant facts continued in motion.
2:03 pm  Argument by ADA Johnson.
2:06 pm  Argument by Attorney Malchow.
2:07 pm  Court finds the second prong of test has been met by clear and convicing evidence.  Evaluation did occur after sentencing.
2:09 pm  As to the first prong, Court does not find that the new evaluation is highly relevant.
2:11 pm  Court found at the time of sentencing that the seriousness and gravity of the offense outweighed any question anyone had that he was at risk to re-offend.
2:18 pm  Court believes original sentence was the minimum amount of custody to meet defendant's rehabilitative needs.
2:19 pm  For all the reasons state on the record, Court is denying defendant's motion.

records.addlTxt: Temporary Commitment form filed

10:02 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Defendant John G. Beles in court, in custody with Atty Dudley A. Williams.  
ADA Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court notes that it also has file 15CF221 on the calendar for status.  Atty Williams has spoken with his client and he believes it would be better under the circumstances that another Attorney represent Mr. Beles on that file.  Atty Donohoo has no objection to this and would suggest 15CF221 be put over for a short period of time in order for Mr. Beles to contact the public defender's office.  Court will grant the Motion to withdraw but advises Atty Williams that he will need to submit, via e-filing, a Motion to withdraw as well an Order for the Court's signature.  
Court schedules status conference on file 2015CF000221 for March 29, 2017 at 1:15 pm.  
10:06 am  Court makes record with regard to charges and maximum potential penalties.  Court has reviewed the PSI and the sentencing memorandum filed by the defense including all of the letters of support.  
10:07 am  Atty Donohoo makes record with regard to compliance with victim's rights.  
10:08 am  Atty Williams has reviewed the PSI with his client and has no corrections or additions.  
10:08 am  Court makes note of correction with regard to eligibility for programming.  Court believes defendant is not eligible for CIP or SAP.  
10:10 am  Neither side has anyone who wishes to make any statements to the Court.  
10:11 am  Penny Vogt is sworn and testifies on exam of Atty Donohoo.
Exhibit 1 marked and identified as TIS, Act 1
10:22 am  Cross exam of Ms. Vogt by Atty Williams.  
10:32 am  Redirect by Atty Donohoo.  
10:33 am  Recross by Atty Williams.  
10:34 am  Redirect by Atty Donohoo.  
10:35 am  Witness excused.  
10:36 am  Raymond Brunner is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Donohoo.  
10:40 am  No cross by Atty Williams.  Witness excused.  
10:41 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Donohoo.  
11:18 am  Court takes 5 minute recess.  
11:27 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Williams.  
12:07 pm  Statement by defendant.  
12:11 pm  Court takes brief recess to consider this matter.  
12:21 pm  Court in session.  Same appearances.  
12:22 pm  Court proceeds with making its record and sentencing the defendant.

SENTENCE:  
Ct 1:  Total length of sentence: 13 yrs; 7 yrs IC; 6 yrs ES;
Ct 2:  Total length of sentence:  13 yrs, 7 yrs IC; 6 yrs ES; concurrent with Ct. 1;  
Sixty (67) days of dead time credit;  
NOT eligible for CIP or SAP;  

CONDITIONS OF ES:  
1)  Register as a sex offender and comply with SORP conditions and expectations of program;  
2)  No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  
3)  Obtain any counseling and comply with any recommendations of Probation Agent.  
4)  No contact with L.A.B., dob 05/30/09, without approval of victim's mother and probation agent.  
5)  No unsupervised contact with minors.  
6)  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  
7)  Pay court costs.  
8)  Maintain employment.  
Court gives warnings:  1)  May not vote until civil rights are restored; 2) May not possess a firearm;  3)  May not work with or volunteer with children;  4)  May not possess body armor;  

Attorney Williams makes motion with regard to the defendant's cash bail.  Court orders that the court obligations be paid from the cash bail and that any balance be returned to the person who posted.  Bond is quashed on defendant's cases.  1:02 pm   Court in recess.  


**TRANSCRIPT FILED 10-23-17: COURT REPORTER LINDA MATOSKA**
Sentencing Letters
Sentencing Memorandum
AMENDED to correct due date of PSI

State's Memo Regarding a Patino Closing Argument
In Court file
Alternates
Verdict NO. 3 - Guilty
Verdict NO. 1 - Guilty

Defendant's bond is revoked pending his sentencing hearing.  Defendant is taken in custody.

Court in session 8:08 am  
Bailiffs:  Jim Heraldson and Jan Chambers.  
ADA Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin with Court Officer Erik Voss.  
Defendant John G. Beles in court with Atty Dudley A. Williams.  
8:09 am  Atty Williams is ready to proceed with his cross exam of Ms. Hocking.  
Attys agree that a defense witness has one prior conviction.  
Atty Williams request that Deft's mother and father would like to be present in the Courtroom.  Atty Donohoo objects at this time.  Parents will not be allowed in courtroom at his time.  
8:11 am  Discussion concerning Atty Donohoo's e-mail concerning Hazeltine issue relating to Rachel Beles.  
8:14 am  Paula Hocking is sworn by Clerk.  
8:15 am  Jurors seated in courtroom.  
8:15 am  Continued cross exam of Ms. Hocking by Atty Williams.

Exhibit 12 marked and id' as Allison Schaper's CV

8:19 am  Atty Donohoo has objection.  Jurors excused from courtroom.  
8:20 am  Argument by Atty Donohoo.  
8:23 am  Question of Atty Williams by Court as to relevance?  Atty Williams will withdraw the question.  
8:22 am  Jurors return to courtroom.  Continued cross exam of Ms. Hocking by Atty Williams.  
8:56 am  Redirect by Atty Donohoo.  

Exhibit 13 is marked.  Atty Donohoo requests that Court take Judicial notice of "State's Summary of Expert Testimony"
Discussion between Court and Attorneys as to when the document became part of the court record.  
9:00 am  No recross by Atty Williams.  Witness is excused.  Atty Williams is NOT moving Exhibit 12 into evidence.  

9:01  Erik Voss is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Donohoo. 
Exhibit 14 marked and identified as report of Det. Voss.  
Exhibit 15 marked and identified as Transcript of Det. Voss' interview with Rachel Beles. 
9:25 am  Cross exam of Det. Voss by Atty Williams.  
9:33 am  Atty Donohoo moves Exhibit 14 to extent testified to - received by Court.
Exhibit 15 offered and received to extent testified to.  
9:34 am  State rests.  
9:35 am  Jurors excused from courtroom.  
9:35 am  Discussion between Court and Attys with regard to exhibits.  
9:38 am  Court in recess.  

9:49 am  Court back in session with Deft and Attorneys.  
9:50 am  Discussion between Court and Atty's with regard to State's changed position on Hazeltine testimony of Rachel Beles.  Atty Williams expresses frustration with the State.  He believes there should be a remedy.  He is not asking for a mistrial but would ask the Court to dismiss the case.   
9:55 am  Response by Atty Donohoo.  
10:06 am  Rebuttal by Atty Williams.  
10:06 am  Court agrees that the door has been opened and if the defense wants to, they may recall Rachel Beles.  It can be offered only for why she did what she did.  
10:08 am  Atty Williams makes record as to what he intends to argue by reasonable inferences from the testimony as the record exists now.  Response by Court.  Continued discussion between Court and Attys.  
10:12 am  Atty Williams makes further record.  10:13 am  Response by Court.  10:15 am  Atty Williams understands the Court's order but has concerns about State's argument.  10:17 am  Response by Atty Donohoo.  10:17 am  Response by Atty Williams.  Continued discussion between Court and Attys with regard to State's argument to the jury.  Court will not make that kind of limiting decision concerning arguments to jury at this time.  Court is not dismissing this case and not imposing a sanction against the State.  
10:21 am  Court has colloquy with Mr. Beles as to his right to testify or not testify.  Response by Atty Williams to Court's questions.  Court finds his decision to not testify has been made freely, knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  
10:21 am  Atty Williams makes a Motion to Dismiss at closure of State's case.  Response by Atty Donohoo.  Further argument by Atty Williams.  Response by State.  10:24 am  Court makes record and denies Motion to Dismiss.  
10:27 am  Court goes over jury instructions with Attys.  Discussion concerning criminal history for witness.  Court will finish jury instructions after the close of all evidence.  10:35 am  Court takes short recess.  
10:41 am  Court in session.  Atty Williams will be calling Frank Beles as a witness.  Court has colloquy with Mr. Frank Beles.  Continued discussion between Court and Attys as to what State will be asking of Mr. Beles.  Court makes statement as to what can be asked of the witness by the State.  
10:46 am  Jury seated in Courtroom.  
10:47 am  Frank Beles, Jr. is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Williams.  Exhibits 16 and 17 marked and id'd as photos.  Exhibits 16 and 17 are offered and received.  
10:51 am  Cross exam by Atty Donohoo.  
10:52 am  No redirect.  Defense rests.
10:52 am  Record for evidence is closed.  
10:53 am  Jurors are excused for lunch hour and asked to return at 12:15 pm.  

10:54 am  Court has jury instruction conference with Attorneys.  Atty Williams would like a limiting instruction.  Court will prepare the modified Instructions.  Atty Donohoo intends to bring up some of the witnesses who were named and subpoenaed but not called to testify.  Atty Williams wants to know who these witnesses are that she is referencing.  Atty Donohoo names witnesses.  Response by Atty Williams.  Response by Atty Donohoo.  Court will allow Atty Williams time to review the case.  Court will reconvene at 12:00 p.m.  11:24 am  Court in recess.  

12:02 pm  Court in session with Attys and Deft.  Court provides Attys with copies of jury instructions prepared by the Court.  No objection by Attys to Instructions to be given to jury.  
12:04 pm  Court next addresses State's Patino Motion.  Atty Donohoo has no additional argument.  Atty Williams objects to the Motion and argues he believes it shifts the burden of proof.  12:06 pm  Response by Atty Donohoo.  12:06 pm  Court makes ruling and will grant State's request.  
12:11 pm  Court in recess.  

12:18 pm  Court in session.  Appearances are the same.  
12:20 pm  Jury seated in Courtroom.  
12:20 pm  Court Instructs the Jury.  
12:38 pm  Closing argument by Atty Donohoo.  
1:39 pm  Court takes 10 minute recess.  

1:50 pm  Court in session.  Same appearances.  Jurors seated in courtroom.  
1:51 pm  Closing argument by Atty Williams.  
2:25 pm  Rebuttal argument by Atty Donohoo.  
2:35 pm  Court gives final instructions to Jurors.  
2:41 pm  Alternate jurors are released at this time - #2487 and #5943.  Court admonishes that they may not discuss this with anyone until a verdict is reached. 
2:44 pm  Clerk gives Oath to Bailiffs.  
2:44 pm  Jurors excused from courtroom to begin their deliberations.  
2:45 pm  Attys have no objection to the Instructions as read by the Court.  
2:46 pm  Atty Williams makes record as to his continuing objections.  
2:47 pm  Court believes appropriate and full arguments were made on the record and those objections are reserved.  
2:47 pm  Response by Atty Donohoo.  
2:48 pm  Court thought both gave excellent closing arguments, within the law and within what the court ruled in this matter.  The Court believes both sides followed the Court's instructions.  
2:49 pm  Court in recess.  

4:04 pm  Court in session with Attorneys and deft.  Jurors have a question - they are requesting an Exhibit - the police report.  
4:05 pm  Response by Atty Donohoo.  Response by Attorney Williams.  Court notes the jurors were given an instruction with regard to police reports.  Further argument by Atty Donohoo as to what portion of the report they would be allowed to see.  Court would like to know if there is something in particular that they are looking for and will respond to their question in that way.  Court will send written response back to jurors with the Bailiff.  4:10 pm  Court in recess.  
4:15 pm  Same appearances.  Jurors have sent another question back.  Attys agree that response should be that they will have to rely on their collective memories as to any properly admitted evidence.  
4:17 pm  Court in recess.  
4:41 pm  Court in session with Attys and Deft.  Court has another note from Jurors - marked as Court Exh #2 requesting photo (Exhibit #1).  No objection by Attys.  Exhibit is sent back to jurors. 4:42 pm  Court in recess. 
6:26 pm  Court in session.  Appearances are the same.  The Jury has reached a verdict.  
6:27 pm  Jurors seated in courtroom.  Court reads verdicts.  Deft found guilty of Ct #1 and Ct. #2 as charged in the Information; 
6:29 pm  Atty Williams requests court poll the jury.  Court polls jurors.  
6:30 pm  Court thanks jurors for their service.  
6:31 pm  Jurors excused from courtroom.  
6:31 pm  Response by Atty Donohoo.  Motion by Attorney Williams.  
6:32 pm  Court enters judgments of conviction with regard to both counts.  
6:32 pm  Court will ask her clerk to contact the attorneys via e-mail to schedule the court dates on the bail jumping case.  
6:33 pm  Atty Donohoo asks for revocation of defendant's bond.   Atty Williams asks that the Court consider continuing the bond.  
6:35 pm  Court makes record and revokes defendant's bond pending sentencing.  Pre-sentence investigation ordered;  Sentencing hearing on:  March 15, 2017 at 10:00 am (2 hours reserved).  
6:37 pm  Court in recess.

**TRANSCRIPT FILED 10-19-17: COURT REPORTER LINDA MATOSKA**
1/10/2017 Email from Atty Donohoo re:  Hazeltine testimony

Court in session 8:25 am  
Bailiffs:  Jim Heraldson and Jan Chambers.  
ADA Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin with Court Officer Erik Voss.  
Defendant John G. Beles in court with Atty Dudley A. Williams.  
Court makes record as to an e-mail it received from Atty Donohoo.  Atty Williams acknowledges receiving a copy of the e-mail.  
Discussion between Court and Attys with regard to first witness.  
8:32 am  Jury seated in courtroom.  Court addresses jurors.  
8:33 am  L.B. called as State's first witness.  Court has colloquy with L.B. with regard to difference between telling the truth or telling a lie.  Court believes L.B. knows the difference between the truth and a lie. 
8:38 am  Direct exam of L.B. by Atty Donohoo.  

8:52 am - Exhibit 1 marked and identified as photo of L.B. and social worker  

8:54 am  No cross by Atty Williams.  Witness excused.  
8:55 am  Both Attys agree that L.B. may be excused.  
8:55 am  Rachel Beles is worn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Donohoo.  

9:07 am - Exhibit 1 is offered, received and published.  
9:28 am - Exhibit 2 marked and identified as Crime Victim compensation application.  
9:35 am - Exhibit 2 is offered and received to extent testified to (pages 1 thru 5)

9:35 am  Continued direct exam of Rachel Beles by Atty Donohoo.  
9:38 am  Jury excused from Courtroom for morning break.  

9:40 am  Attys and defendant are present.  Court addresses issues with regard to the statements by the defendant which the Court had previously ruled admissible.  
9:40 am  Argument by Attorney Donohoo that it is admissible because it is the defendant's statement.  
9:46 am  Argument by Atty Williams that it is not probative or relevant.  
9:50 am  Response by Atty Donohoo.  
9:52 am  Court takes recess to consider this issue further.  

10:09 am  Court back on record with Attorneys and defendant.  
10:10 am  Court makes ruling - Crawford evidence does not come in under any other acts analysis.  Court does wish to make a complete record on this.  Under Sullivan, the Court does not believe it is relevant under Sec. 904.01.  Court also does not believe this is a "Dukes" type situation.  Court makes record with regard to Sec. 908.06.  State cannot bring in extrinsic information through the officer.  Court responds to Atty Williams' question with regard to the probative value.  Court finds that the probative value is not outweighed by the danger of unfair prejudice.  Atty Williams asks that Court make record as to motion for mistrial.  
10:19 am  Response by Atty Donohoo.  10:21 am  Court makes record there will not be any opinion evidence that this deft does not meet the profile for a person who is sexually interested in children.  Court denies Motion for Mistrial.  

10:28 am  State's next witness Amy Bahr is present in Court.  Court has colloquy with Ms. Bahr with regard to her testimony.  Atty Donohoo makes clarification as to type of questions she will be asking Ms. Bahr.  10:30 am  Ms. Bahr is excused from courtroom.  

10:31 am  Jury seated in Courtroom.  Court advises Jurors that Court is taking judicial notice that the criminal complaint was filed on May 8, 2015.  
10:32 am  Cross exam of Ms. Beles by Attorney Williams.  

10:49 am  Jury excused from courtroom.  
10:50 am  Court hears State's objection and argument of Attys.  
10:56 am  Court needs to have an offer of proof as to what Ms. Beles would testify to.  Response by Ms. Beles to Court's questions.  
10:57 am  Court makes record.  Court does not fit in under the residual exception.  Objection is sustained.  
11:01 am  Jurors seated in courtroom.  Court advises Jurors that the State objection is sustained and that they are to disregard last answer from Ms. Beles
11:01 am  Continued cross exam of Ms. Beles by Atty Williams.  
11:32 am  Redirect of Ms. Beles by Atty Donohoo.  
11:36 am  Jury excused from courtroom while court hears argument with regard to hearsay objection by Atty Williams.  Atty Williams asks for an offer of proof.  Argument by Atty Donohoo and Atty Williams.  
11:43 am  Court will take lunch recess at this time and Court will ask Jurors to return at 1:00 p.m.  Court ask Attys and deft to be here at 12:45 for Court's decision.    Discussion concerning questions asked by Atty Williams and collateral consequences.  
11:44 am  Court in recess.  

1:01 pm  Court in session with Attys and defendant.  Court makes ruling on Motion regarding introduction of evidence through Ms. Beles.  Court reviewed statutes and cases over the lunch break and also reviewed Blinka.  Court rules that the objection with regard to hearsay is sustained.  Case does not think the case law or statutes or Blinka specifically support the State's position.  Wis. Stat. Sec. 908.06(2) also says that the evidence still has to be admissible.  There are very limited ways to bring in extrinsic evidence.  1:09 am  Response by Atty Donohoo - She wants to be able to establish before Jury that deft was arrested and bonded out.  Atty Williams has no problem with court instructing jury that he bonded out.  Atty Williams expresses concerns about what was stated to jury before they were released.  Atty Williams makes record with regard to Ms. Beles phone and Atty Williams concerns that he has no knowledge of what is on the phone and he wants the opportunity to review it.  1:14 pm  Response by Atty Donohoo with regard to text messages on the phone.  1:17 pm  Response by Court.  1:18 pm  Response by Atty Donohoo.  She wants to put the 3 texts up from the phone up on the screen.  Atty Williams is objecting.  Court notes both sides got late notice of this and will allow it.  

1:21 pm  Jury now seated in courtroom.  Court makes record for jury that Court sustained the defense objection that was made prior to jury being excused for lunch.  Court makes further record as to stipulation reached by the Attorneys regarding dates/times when Mr. Beles was arrested, posted bond and was released from custody.  
1:22 pm  Continued redirect of Ms. Beles by Atty Donohoo.  Text messages from Ms. Beles cell phone are published to the Jury.  State will take a picture of the phone and then the picture will be marked as Exhibit 4.  
1:33 pm  Recross by Atty Williams.  
1:33 pm  Redirect by Atty Donohoo.  
1:34 pm  Witness excused.  

1:35 pm  Sonja Schlesner is sworn and testified on direct exam of Atty Donohoo.  
1:40 pm  No questions of witness by Atty Williams.  Witness is excused.  

1:41 pm  Amy Bahr is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Donohoo.  

Exhibit 5 marked and id'd as Child Protective Services Report.  

1:53 pm  Atty Williams has objection.  
1:54 pm  Response by Atty Donohoo.  
1:55 pm  Jurors excused from courtroom.  
1:55 pm  Atty Donohoo makes record as to statement that the State intends to introduce.  
1:56 pm  Response by Atty Williams that it is not relevant.  
1:57 pm  Response by Atty Donohoo.  
1:59 pm  Response by Court.  
2:01 pm  Attorney Donohoo withdraws her question.  

2:02 pm  Jury seated in Courtroom.  Court explains that State has withdrawn it's last question and jurors are not to consider it.  
2:03 pm  Cross exam by Atty Williams.  
2:04 pm  Witness is excused.  

2:05 pm  Taume Kohl is sworn is testifies on direct exam of Atty Donohoo.  Exhibit 6 marked and identified as APFV form.  Court takes judicial notice of the form which was filed with the Court on Sept. 22, 2015. 
2:20 pm  Cross exam by Atty Williams.  
2:23 pm  Redirect by Atty Donohoo.  
2:25 pm  Exhibit 5 is offered and received into evidence.  
2:25 pm  Jury excused from courtroom for 10 minute recess.  

2:37 pm  Court in session with Attys and Defendant.  Atty Donohoo provides Court with copy of the cell phone.  The photocopy has been marked has Exhibit 4 and is offered and received.  
2:38 pm  Jury seated in courtroom.  
2:39 pm  Dr. Angela Rabbitt is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Donohoo.  

Exhibit 7 is marked and identified 4-page report of child's visit with Dr. Rabbitt.  The document was redacted by the Court in the interest of protecting the child's privacy.  
Exhibit 7 is offered and received.  

2:53 pm  Cross exam by Atty Williams.  
2:59 pm  Witness excused.  

3:00 pm  Paula Hocking is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Donohoo.  

Exhibit 8 marked and id'd as Curriculum Vitae of Paula Hocking.  
Exhibit 8 is offered and received.  
Exhibit 9 marked and id'd as CD recording of child interview

2:30 pm FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR:  3:28 pm Case called.

Attorney Williams is asking Court to make a decision with regard to admissibility.  Court has not yet had a chance to review the DVD recording.  Once the Court has had a chance to review it, the Court's clerk will send the attys an e-mail with the Court's decision.  Second  issue is with regard to motion on Richard A.P. testimony.  Court recites Judge Reddy's prior ruling on this.  Atty Williams indicates that the Defense does not intend to call Dr. Woody.  Third issue  - State's Notice of Expert with regard to Paula Hocking.  Court did find transcript portion where Judge Reddy had already made an oral ruling on this issue.  Atty Williams understands that what Judge Reddy ruled was that there was a list of issues noted in the Notice.  There are a number of things that didn't seem to be relevant to this case.  It would be objectionable if the State would elicit any topics that went beyond Judge Reddy's Order.  Response by Atty Donohoo that issues is whether the defense has been put on notice of the general subject matter.  Atty Donohoo objects to some kind of limitation on Ms. Hocking's testimony.  Court references page 105 of the transcript from the hearing before by Judge Reddy.  Court agrees with State's position and Judge Reddy's ruling.  State doesn't need to detail out each separate item that the State's expert might testify to.  

Atty Williams filed Motion with regard to production of exculpatory evidence.  Asst. Corp. Counsel Navis is present in Court on behalf of the County but is not making a formal appearance.  He is here to answer any questions.  Atty Donohoo tenders to Court a series of e-mails between ADA Donohoo and Attorney Williams.  Atty Donohoo wants this trial to go forward on Monday.  The e-mails referenced by Atty Donohoo are marked as Exhibit #1.  The medical examination records are in the Departments files but they were not forwarded because they didn't contain any statements.  State received the Bellows materials in February of 2016.  Atty Donohoo notes that Defense counsel never listed Dr. Rabbitt as a witness.  

3:42 pm  Response by Atty Williams with regard to the medical evaluation of the victim and whether records should be released.  
4:56 pm  Court in session.  Court did have the CHIPS file pulled which the Court has reviewed.  At the time Judge Drettwan was the Juvenile Court  Judge, she did not authorize release of the medical records that are at issue here.  
4:57 pm  Response by Atty Donohoo to argument made by Atty Williams.  She argues that Det. Voss had no participation in the medical exam being done.   The victim, the child, has rights.  Atty Donohoo argues that if we agree that Dr. Rabbitt's report comes in, it must include specific language from that report.  State would want to get in Dr. Rabbitt's report through either Paula Hocking or Amy Bahr.  
5:09 pm  Response by Atty Williams that he is not comfortable with proceeding as proposed by Atty Donohoo.  He wants to see what examination was done.  Atty Williams believe it could be potentially 
ineffective assistance of counsel.  5:10 pm  Response by Atty Donohoo.  5:10 pm Further argument by Atty Williams.  He believes Court has authority to release the report.  Court indicates Judge Johnson will hold a Bellows motion  tomorrow at 3:30 or Friday morning at 8:30 or he also has all Friday afternoon open.  Court will make sure that Attorney Johnson is there as GAL or that another Attorney is available as GAL.  Court orders that mother be at that hearing and that she have the child here.  Mother should contact GAL to make sure the child can speak with the GAL.  
Atty Donohoo believes a record needs with regard to defendants waiver confrontation.   Response by Court.  Response by Atty Williams.  He believes this can be resolved if he sees the report.  
Court schedules Bellows motion for hearing tomorrow, Thursday at 3:30 pm before Judge Johnson.  Atty Navis will check on his calendar for tomorrow.  Atty Navis makes record as to what documents he has reviewed.  His recollection is that none of the statements that he reviewed address the underlying circumstances of the criminal case.  Atty Navis will bring all of the materials for the hearing tomorrow before Judge Johnson.   5:21 pm  Atty Navis is excused at this time.  
Court addresses child's mother about child being hear tomorrow at 3:00 pm and for the trial on Monday.  
5:26 pm  Court has received a letter from the State requesting proposed Order with regard to release of crime victim comp records.   Atty Williams has no objection.  Court has signed the Order.  
Motions in Limine filed by both sides.  Most of them are standard motions and some are duplicative.   Court grants motion to exclude witnesses from courtroom.  State will have a Court Officer; victim and her mother are also allowed to be present in Court; 
Court will instruct jury that if they wish to discuss responses outside presence of other jurors, it will be conducted in a jury room.  No objection by Attys.  Court addresses the defendant personally on this matter.  
Defense is asking Court give standard instructions 140 and 300  Court will do that.  Atty Donohoo also requesting credibility of child witnesses as well.  Atty Williams is asking that Court give the substantive instruction.  Court will not give that instruction in the preliminary instructions.  Court believes it could be confusing to the jury.  
Court addresses States motions in limine.  Jury should not hear anything about collateral consequences, about penalty or that this is a felony.   Neither side is allowed to bring out evidence as to character, reputation, etc  unless first addressed outside presence of jury.  
Discussion concerning Item 8a & 8b of States Motions in Limine.  Argument by Attys.  Court will not allow that type of testimony or evidence but it could be revisited.   8b  Court finds it would not be relevant or admissible.  Atty Donohoo makes further record as to 8b.  
Discussion as to item 9  prior records.  Atty Williams does not believe his client has any criminal record.   
If parties have exhibits, Court asks the parties organize them and provide them to Court's clerk for marking.  Atty Donohoo does not believe she has a whole lot of exhibits.  Court will seat 2 alternate jurors.  Court will seat 24 jurors on the box for voir dire.  Court wants to start at 8:30 am each day.  
Both counsel agree that the 2 files have never been joined and the bail jump file will not be tried on Monday.  
Atty Donohoo asks Court to have colloquy with defendant with regard to any offers that the State has made in this case.  Atty Donohoo makes record as to the States offer.  
5:47 pm  Court has colloquy with Mr. Beles with regard to States offer.  Mr. Beles understands the offer that was made to him by the State.  He is rejecting the offer.  
5:49 pm  Court will stay in contact with both Attys via the Court's clerk.  State agrees that it will not release any witnesses without advising Atty Williams.
